title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON – On a night when baskets were a precious commodity, one man authored a historic masterpiece. Larry Bird, defying age and a grinding defensive battle, delivered a performance for the ages, carrying the Boston Celtics to a hard-fought 97-88 victory over the Washington Wizards.

In a game where the final score belied an offensive struggle, Bird was a beacon of sublime efficiency and sheer will. While teammates faltered, the veteran forward was a one-man offensive system, pouring in a game-high 47 points. He was relentless, attacking the rim, hitting from mid-range, and stretching the defense with his trademark precision. His 47-point outburst wasn't just a high total; it was a lifeline for a Celtics team that desperately needed every single one.

Washington, led by a gritty 19-point effort from Chris Webber, hung around through sheer tenacity. They turned the contest into a physical, half-court grind, but they had no answer for Bird’s singular brilliance. Every time the Wizards threatened to close the gap, Bird had a response—a silky jumper, a tough drive, a dagger three. He was the entire narrative, the reason the Boston Garden faithful erupted with every possession.

This was more than just a regular-season win. This was a testament to greatness, a reminder that on any given night, a legend can transcend the game itself. The final buzzer sounded on a Celtics victory, but the lasting memory was of number 33, having shouldered the entire burden and delivered one of the most unforgettable performances of his storied career.
